segment.source: Audit account management (Windows 10)
segment.target: Audit account management (Windows 10)

segment.source: Determines whether to audit each event of account management on a device.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit each event of account management on a device.

segment.source: Audit account management
segment.target: Audit account management

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Determines whether to audit each event of account management on a device.
segment.target: Determines whether to audit each event of account management on a device.

segment.source: Examples of account management events include:
segment.target: Examples of account management events include:

segment.source: A user account or group is created, changed, or deleted.
segment.target: A user account or group is created, changed, or deleted.

segment.source: A user account is renamed, disabled, or enabled.
segment.target: A user account is renamed, disabled, or enabled.

segment.source: A password is set or changed.
segment.target: A password is set or changed.

segment.source: If you define this policy setting, you can specify whether to audit successes, audit failures, or not audit the event type at all.
segment.target: If you define this policy setting, you can specify whether to audit successes, audit failures, or not audit the event type at all.

segment.source: Success audits generate an audit entry when any account management event succeeds.
segment.target: Success audits generate an audit entry when any account management event succeeds.

segment.source: Failure audits generate an audit entry when any account management event fails.
segment.target: Failure audits generate an audit entry when any account management event fails.

segment.source: To set this value to No auditing, in the Properties dialog box for this policy setting, select the Define these policy settings check box and clear the Success and Failure check boxes.
segment.target: To set this value to No auditing, in the Properties dialog box for this policy setting, select the Define these policy settings check box and clear the Success and Failure check boxes.

segment.source: Default:
segment.target: Default:

segment.source: Success on domain controllers.
segment.target: Success on domain controllers.

segment.source: No auditing on member servers.
segment.target: No auditing on member servers.

segment.source: Configure this audit setting
segment.target: Configure this audit setting

segment.source: You can configure this security setting by opening the appropriate policy under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesAudit Policy.
segment.target: You can configure this security setting by opening the appropriate policy under Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesAudit Policy.

segment.target: Account management events

segment.target: Description

segment.source: A user account was created.
segment.target: A user account was created.

segment.target: A user password was changed.

segment.target: A user password was set.

segment.target: A user account was deleted.

segment.source: A global group was created.
segment.target: A global group was created.

segment.target: A member was added to a global group.

segment.source: A member was removed from a global group.
segment.target: A member was removed from a global group.

segment.target: A global group was deleted.

segment.target: A new local group was created.

segment.target: A local group account was changed.

segment.source: A user account was changed.

segment.target: A domain policy was modified.

segment.source: A local security group with security disabled was created.
segment.target: A local security group with security disabled was created.

segment.source: Note: SECURITY_DISABLED in the formal name means that this group cannot be used to grant permissions in access checks.
segment.target: Note: SECURITY_DISABLED in the formal name means that this group cannot be used to grant permissions in access checks.

segment.target: A local security group with security disabled was changed.

segment.target: A member was added to a security-disabled local security group.

segment.target: A member was removed from a security-disabled local security group.

segment.target: A security-disabled local group was deleted.

segment.source: Set the security descriptor of members of administrative groups.
segment.target: Set the security descriptor of members of administrative groups.

segment.source: Set the security descriptor of members of administrative groups.
segment.target: Set the security descriptor of members of administrative groups.

segment.source: Note: Every 60 minutes on a domain controller a background thread searches all members of administrative groups (such as domain, enterprise, and schema administrators) and applies a fixed security descriptor on them.
segment.target: Note: Every 60 minutes on a domain controller a background thread searches all members of administrative groups (such as domain, enterprise, and schema administrators) and applies a fixed security descriptor on them.

segment.source: This event is logged.
segment.target: This event is logged.
